alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 8:20PM EST until March 11 at 11:37PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess, Greene, Knox and Martin. * WHEN...Until midnight EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vincennes, Washington, Linton, Bloomfield, Shoals, Bicknell, Loogootee, Jasonville, Worthington, Odon, Lyons, Elnora, Oaktown, Monroe City, Wheatland, Bruceville, Plainville, Sandborn, Montgomery and Edwardsport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
